page.title: 05WARKWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: {Warkworth}village is pleasantly situated{within a large meander}of the River Coquet, giving it the advantage of{defence on three sides,}with the fourth being protected by{the castle. Almost all of the village is{untouched {by modern development.}It possesses many{ancient buildings}including the {castle, the church, and a market cross erected in 1830.{The division of land {in medieval times}can be clearly recognised in the village with each of {the plots extending from the building {on the main street down to the river. The{bridge tower}which was built in the latter part of the 14th century is almost unique.{St Lawrence's Church was burnt down in 1174, fifty years after it was first built, by William the Lion of Scotland. The north wall of the Norman church still remains however in the present building.
